Title5: How is Consumer Privacy and Internet Freedom in Spain?
Section5: In Spain, personal data protection and Internet freedom are mainly regulated by the Organic Law on Data Protection and Guarantee of Digital Rights (LOPDGDD) of 2018, which adapts the European General Data Protection Regulation (RGPD) to the Spanish legal framework. This legislation guarantees fundamental rights such as access, rectification, cancellation and opposition (ARCO rights) of personal data, in addition to new digital rights such as digital disconnection and the protection of minors on the Internet. The Law on Information Society Services and Electronic Commerce (LSSI-CE) regulates electronic commerce and commercial communications, while the General Telecommunications Law establishes the framework for the provision of telecommunications services and access to the Internet. These laws are complemented by the Digital Rights Charter of 2021, which, although not regulatory in nature, establishes a framework for guaranteeing citizens' rights in the digital environment.
